name: Avoid using 'java.io.File'
description: Java artifacts should not use 'java.io.File' for application deployed on a Web Server or an Application Server (when web.xml or ejb-jar.xml file are present)
output:
This report lists all java artifacts using 'java.io.File'.
It provides the following information:
 Artifact full name
rationale: For portability reasons, in Web applications or Application Server, 'java.io.File' should not be used since it means giving an absolute path and therefore being dependent on the environment where the application is deployed.
alternativeName: Prefer not using 'java.io.File' to avoid violating the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification

qualityStandards.name: External Control of File Name or Path
qualityStandards.description: The software allows user input to control or influence paths or file names that are used in filesystem operations.

qualityStandards.name: EJB Bad Practices: Use of Java I/O
qualityStandards.description: The program violates the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification by using the java.io package.
